## Question 3

### Ensemble learning

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(caretEnsemble)
library(caret)
library(randomForest)
library(xgboost)
library(readr)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(SuperLearner)

data <- read_csv("wdbc.data", 
                 col_names = c("ID number",
                               "Diagnosis",
                               "radius_mean",
                               "texture_mean",
                               "perimeter_mean",
                               "area_mean","smoothness_mean",
                               "compactness_mean",
                               "concavity_mean",
                               "concave_points_mean",
                               "symmetry_mean",
                               "fractal_dimension_mean",
                               "radius_SE","texture_SE",
                               "perimeter_SE","area_SE",
                               "smoothness_SE",
                               "compactness_SE",
                               "concavity_SE",
                               "concave_points_SE",
                               "symmetry_SE",
                               "fractal_dimension_SE",
                               "radius_worst",
                               "texture_worst",
                               "perimeter_worst",
                               "area_worst",
                               "smoothness_worst",
                               "compactness_worst",
                               "concavity_worst",
                               "concave_points_worst",
                               "symmetry_worst",
                               "fractal_dimension_worst"))

clean_data <- data %>% 
  select(c(contains("_mean"), Diagnosis)) %>% 
  drop_na()

target <- "Diagnosis"
```

```{r}
set.seed(123)
trainIndex <- createDataPartition(clean_data$Diagnosis, p = 0.7, 
                                   list = FALSE, times = 1)
train <- clean_data[trainIndex,]
test <- clean_data[-trainIndex,]


```

```{r}
model_list <- c("glm", "rf", "gbm")
models <- list()
for (i in 1:length(model_list)) {
  models[[i]] <- train(Diagnosis ~ ., data = train, 
                       method = model_list[i], 
                       trControl = trainControl(method = "cv", number = 5))
}
```

```{r}
ensemble_model <- stack(models, method = "glm")
```
